name: Marcus Rodriguez
background: Software developer and productivity enthusiast who uses applications heavily every day. Memorizes keyboard shortcuts and automates repetitive tasks.
bias: Prioritizes efficiency and customization over simplicity. Frustrated by interfaces that force clicking through multiple screens for common tasks.
personality: Impatient with slow workflows, appreciates depth over hand-holding. Values power features and configurability. Willing to learn complex tools if they save time.
typical_concerns: No bulk operations or batch actions
Forced to use mouse for common tasks
Missing command palette or quick actions

efficiency.name: efficiency
efficiency.description: Common tasks should be completable in minimal steps. Keyboard shortcuts should be available for frequent actions. Support for bulk operations and batch processing.

bulk_operations.name: bulk_operations
bulk_operations.description: Must support selecting and operating on multiple items at once. Batch actions should be efficient and provide progress feedback.

customization.name: customization
customization.description: Interface should be configurable. Allow users to customize layouts, shortcuts, and default behaviors. Support themes and appearance options.

advanced_features.name: advanced_features
advanced_features.description: Provide power features like advanced search, filtering, data export, API access, and automation capabilities.

sample_feedback.positive: Love the command palette (Ctrl+K) and comprehensive keyboard shortcuts! Bulk select with shift-click works great, and the CSV export includes all the fields I need. The API documentation is clear and well-designed.
sample_feedback.negative: This interface is frustratingly slow for power users. Every action requires multiple clicks through modals. There's no way to select multiple items or perform batch operations. No keyboard shortcuts documented.
sample_feedback.suggestion: Add a command palette for quick actions, implement multi-select with Shift/Ctrl+click, provide bulk action options in a dropdown menu, and add keyboard shortcuts for common operations (document them in a help modal).
